results.title: For Love Alone
results.creator_credit: Stephen Wallace, Margaret Fink, Australian Film Commission and Western Film Productions
results.brief_description: The time - the early 1930s. The woman - Teresa Hawkins, 20; her occupation University student. Her degree - love. She studies it with a passion. It is all consuming. She is obsessed. In the 1930s women were not supposed to believe in free love and independence. But that doesn’t stop Teresa. Helen Buday gives an outstanding performance as a woman years ahead of her time. Sam Neill, Hugo Weaving and Huw Williams play three of the men who become part of her passionate life. Based on the novel by Christina Stead.

results.title: Kiss of the Spider Woman
results.creator_credit: Hector Babenco, David Weisman, Sugarloaf and HB Filmes
results.brief_description: Set in a Latin American prison during a military dictatorship, this film explores the relationship that develops between two cellmates: a left wing journalist (Raul Julia) and a homosexual window dresser (William Hurt). To entertain his cellmate during the monotony and horror of prison life, the latter recreates stories from his favourite 1940’s movies. Based on the novel by Manuel Puig, the film features William Hurt’s Oscar winning performance.

results.title: The Grapes of Wrath
results.creator_credit: John Ford, Darryl F. Zanuck, Nunnally Johnson and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Adaptation of John Steinbeck’s famous novel. The dramatic story of the Joad family and their migration to California from their dust-bowl farm in Oklahoma during the Depression. An observance of America during a difficult era, the film reveals considerable compassion for poor, honest people struggling for dignity against seemingly insurmountable odds. Stars Henry Fonda, Jane Darwell, John Carradine and Charley Grapewin.

results.title: Reds
results.brief_description: The story of the love affair of John Reed and Louise Bryant in a war-torn world and how the Russian Revolution shook their lives. Warren Beatty is John Reed, American Communist, journalist and activist who was buried in the Kremlin Wall. Diane Keaton is Louise Bryant, writer and feminist, whose love for Reed carries her across continents. Jack Nicholson is Eugene O’Neill, America’s greatest playwright, whose life intertwines romantically with Bryant’s. Maureen Stapleton portrays anarchist and feminist Emma Goldman, and Jerzy Kosinski plays Bolshevik leader Gregory Zinoviev.

results.title: The Umbrella Woman
results.creator_credit: Ken Cameron, Jan Sharp, Michael Nolin and Laughing Kookaburra Productions
results.brief_description: An innocent passion for a forbidden experience leads Daisy (Rachel Ward) into a three-sided relationship with her forgiving husband (Bryan Brown) and her husband’s brother. When small town prejudice threatens to overturn all their lives Daisy’s sexual pursuit becomes even more of an obsession as she turns her attention to the newly arrived womanising barman (Sam Neill) - with almost tragic consequences.

results.title: Haunters of the deep
results.creator_credit: Andrew Bogle, Gordon L.T. Scott and Longbow Film Company
results.brief_description: In Cornwall, England, a big American company is about to re-open an abandoned tin mine, despite being warned against it. At the turn of the century the mine caved in and many miners were trapped beneath the surface. A ghost is sighted by a local boy - it is the ghost of one of the people trapped during the cave-in and it is trying to warn of disaster.

results.title: Accident
results.brief_description: An Oxford undergraduate is killed in a car crash; his tutor looks back over the tangle of personal relationships that contributed to his death. This screenplay by Harold Pinter, based on the novel by Nicholas Mosley, is a fascinating, if uneven, study of a teacher who becomes involved with his student. Cast includes Dirk Bogarde, Stanley Baker, Michael York and Jacqueline Sassard.

results.title: The Servant
results.creator_credit: Joseph Losey, Norman Priggen and Springbok Films
results.brief_description: A socio-psychological drama in which a servant, Barratt, is hired by an upper-class, self-centred young man, who has moved into a new house at Chelsea where he plans to live with his fiancee after their marriage. Gradually the relationship of servant and master changes as the latter finds himself slowly falling under Barratt’s control Harold Pinter’s superb study of brooding hatred and hypocrisy within the ever-shifting borders of the class struggle is based on the novel ‘The Servant’ by Robin Maugham. Music by John Dankworth. Cast: Dirk Bogarde, Sarah Miles, Wendy Craig, James Fox.

results.title: The Go-between
results.creator_credit: Joseph Losey, Norman Priggen, John Heyman, Robert Velaise, World Film Services and EMI/Parlophone
results.brief_description: Based on L.P. Hartley’s classic Edwardian novel. The screenplay written by Harold Pinter is the story of lost love, youth and innocence. Spending a long hot summer at a Norfolk stately home, a young boy becomes the misunderstood carrier of love letters between an aristocratic lady and a local farmer - a forbidden romance ending in heartbreak and tragedy for all. Cast includes Julie Christie, Dominic Guard, Margaret Leighton, Michael Redgrave, Michael Gough, Edward Fox and Alan Bates.
